question: What is this platform?
answer: This is a platform for customizing the ORBIT chat widget.

question: How do I customize the widget?
answer: You can customize the widget by changing the theme, the system prompt, and the widget configuration.

question: How do I change the theme?
answer: You can change the theme by clicking the theme button in the top right corner of the widget.

question: How do I change the system prompt?
answer: You can change the system prompt by clicking the system prompt button in the top right corner of the widget.

question: How do I change the widget configuration?
answer: You can change the widget configuration by clicking the widget configuration button in the top right corner of the widget.

question: What is the Theming App?
answer: The Theming App is a live playground to configure the ORBIT chat widget, preview changes, and export code for your site.

question: Which tabs are available?
answer: Tabs include Theme (colors & styles), Content (text & suggested questions), Prompt (system prompt), and Code (export HTML/JS).

question: What can I customize in Theme?
answer: Customize primary/secondary/background colors, text colors, message bubbles, input field, suggested question chips, chat button, and icon.

question: What does the Content tab control?
answer: It controls the widget header, welcome title/description, and suggested questions with per-item text and query values.

question: What is the difference between suggested question text and query?
answer: Text is what users see in the chip; query is what gets sent to the assistant when the chip is clicked.

question: How do I change suggested question limits?
answer: Use the Character Limits controls in Content to set max chip text and query lengths; items exceeding limits are auto-truncated.

question: How do I set the system prompt?
answer: Open the Prompt tab and edit the System Prompt. It defines the assistant's behavior and tone.

question: Is the system prompt stored with the widget config?
answer: No. The system prompt is managed separately with your API key and backend; the Code tab exports UI config only.

question: How do I preview my changes?
answer: Run the app and use the live widget in the bottom-right corner. Click the floating button to open and test interactions.

question: How do I export the widget code?
answer: Use the Code tab to copy or download either a full HTML example or a self-contained JavaScript bundle.

question: Which values must I replace in the exported code?
answer: Replace demo API key and API endpoint with your own values before deploying.

question: Where do I set API key and endpoint in the Theming App?
answer: At the top of the app, enter your API Key and API Endpoint, then click Update API Settings.

question: Does updating API settings reinitialize the widget?
answer: The app tries a live update via setApiKey/setApiUrl; if unavailable, it falls back to reinitializing the widget.

question: How do I switch between local build and NPM widget?
answer: Set VITE_WIDGET_SOURCE to 'local' or 'npm', or use npm scripts: dev:local for local build, dev:npm for NPM package.

question: How do I configure local widget paths?
answer: Set VITE_LOCAL_WIDGET_JS_PATH and VITE_LOCAL_WIDGET_CSS_PATH to the built files in ../dist when using local source.

question: How do I select the widget version from NPM?
answer: Set VITE_NPM_WIDGET_VERSION. The app loads JS/CSS from that version via unpkg.

question: How does debug logging work?
answer: In production builds it's off; in dev it's on by default. Override with VITE_WIDGET_DEBUG=true/false as needed.

question: Can I hide the Prompt tab?
answer: Yes. Set VITE_PROMPT_ENABLED=false. The tab is hidden and users are redirected if it was active.

question: Can I prefill the default API endpoint?
answer: Yes. Set VITE_DEFAULT_API_ENDPOINT to your backend URL to pre-populate the field.

question: What GitHub info appears in the app?
answer: A Powered by ORBIT section can show repo stars and forks. Configure with VITE_GITHUB_OWNER and VITE_GITHUB_REPO.

question: How do I run the Theming App?
answer: Use npm run dev (or dev:npm) for NPM source, or npm run dev:local for local builds.

question: How do I build for production?
answer: Use npm run build:npm (recommended) or build:local. Production builds disable debug logging automatically.

question: Where does the widget mount in the page?
answer: The exported bundle ensures a container with id 'chatbot-widget' exists and initializes the widget into it.

question: What if the local build doesn't load?
answer: Ensure you've built the widget (npm run build), verify local paths, check the console, and enable debug logging.

question: What does the Theme tab's icon selection do?
answer: It sets the icon shown on the minimized chat button. Choose from categorized icon options.

question: What parts of the UI do colors affect?
answer: Primary: header/minimized button; Secondary: send button; Background: panel; Text colors; Bubbles: user/assistant; Input and suggested chips.

question: How do I apply a preset theme?
answer: In Theme, click a preset card to apply its palette instantly; you can still tweak individual colors afterward.

question: Can I reset my color changes?
answer: Reapply a preset or manually change colors back. Preset selection overwrites current custom colors.

question: How do I change the widget header and welcome text?
answer: Use the Content tab to edit Widget Header, Welcome Title, and Welcome Description with live character counts.

question: How do I add or remove suggested questions?
answer: In Content, use the Suggested Questions manager to add new items, edit text/query, or remove entries.

question: Where is the live preview?
answer: The floating chat button at the bottom-right opens the widget. All edits apply instantly for testing.

question: How do I download the generated code?
answer: In Code, choose HTML or JavaScript, then click Download. You can also copy to clipboard.

question: What is the JavaScript bundle option for?
answer: It provides a single importable script that loads React, ReactDOM, widget assets, and initializes the widget with your config.

question: Does the Theming App show which widget source is active?

question: What is ORBIT in this context?
answer: ORBIT is the broader project that includes the chat widget and this Theming App used to configure and preview it.

question: How do I troubleshoot API errors?
answer: Verify your API endpoint and key, update via Update API Settings, check console logs, and ensure CORS/HTTPS are correctly configured.

question: Can I use this content for RAG answers in the widget?
answer: Yes. These Q&A entries describe the Theming App and widget usage and can seed your RAG knowledge for in-widget help.

question: What is the current release status?
answer: The ORBIT chat widget and Theming App are currently in beta testing. Features and APIs may change as we iterate on feedback.

question: Is the Theming App free to use?
answer: Yes. During the beta period the Theming App is free to use at no charge.

question: How can I customize colors?
answer: Open the Theme tab to adjust primary/secondary/background, text colors, user/assistant bubbles, input background/border, suggested chip background/hover/text, chat button colors, and the icon.

question: Where do I set the API key?
answer: At the top of the app, enter your API Key and API Endpoint, then click Update API Settings to apply them (live update if supported, otherwise reinitialize).

question: How do I export code?
answer: Use the Code tab to copy or download a full HTML example or a self-contained JavaScript bundle. Replace the demo API key and API endpoint before deploying.

question: Is it in beta and free?
answer: Yes. The ORBIT widget and Theming App are in beta and free to use during the beta period.

question: How do I show a service unavailable banner?
answer: Set the environment variable VITE_UNAVAILABLE_MSG=true. The app displays a red banner informing users the service is temporarily unavailable.

question: What does the header badge indicate?

question: Can I customize fonts or add custom CSS from the app?

question: Can I run with fewer logs during development?

question: How do I report an issue or view the repo?

question: Any CI/CD examples?
